data.title: Aoife Mulholland on LinkedIn: I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as a Counsellor for…
data.meta_description: I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as a Counsellor for Young Adults at Dublin Simon Community!
data.text:
Sometimes contact for looked after children is instigated without careful consideration of what it means to the child and without the right support for the contact system (the child, carer and birth relative) to make it meaningful. As a result, contact that may have benefited the child could unnecessarily be stopped or unsafe contact might be continued. To encourage decisions about contact arrangements to include consideration of how face-to-face contact can be supported to achieve positive well-being outcomes for children, Clinical Psychologists, Dr Chris Burke and Dr Anne Woodhouse, developed a framework to aid professionals involved in decision-making. The framework, known as the Safe and Meaningful Contact (SaMC) Guidelines, helps users to organise their thinking about contact arrangements around the developmental needs of the child or young person, and to consider the extent to which contact can be supported to play a part in the child or young person’s developmental progress and recovery. Attend the training to become a licensed user of the guidelines. https://lnkd.in/eKMn2Qwv #childwellbeing #SaMCGuidelines #contactarrangements

Teaching teens to recognize, prevent, and address abuse is vital for their safe transition to adulthood. It enables them to set boundaries, ensuring their safety, and fosters resilience for healthier relationships. Encouraging them to speak out promotes a culture of accountability and support, benefiting both personal growth and community well-being. This proactive approach helps build a more empathetic and just society. #teencoaching #teensupport #transitions #boundariesmatter #promote #safeteens #childabuseprevention #educateyourself #personalgrowth

Going back to school after a break can be daunting for many children, here are some practical tips to ease any worries they may have from our Developmental Therapists here at bibic If you have any of your own tips - let us know in the comments

Happy Monday! Here are some tips to help you move in the right direction! Imara Counseling Services clinicians work with adults, teenagers, children older than five years, and couples in all stages of their relationships. We strive to ensure every one of our clients is seen, heard, and understood. Visit imaracounseling.com for more information and to learn more about our team and services! #imaracounseling #dmvtherapist #blacktherapists #marylandtherapist #blackmaletherapist #blackfemaletherapist #mentalhealthawareness #blackmentalhealthmatters #blackmentalhealth #livepeacefully #childtherapist

About a week ago, Noah Boakye-Yiadom did a presentation about the need for and the availability of Black Mental Health First Aid training. If you missed it, want to take a second look, or want to share it with others, here's a link to the replay: https://buff.ly/3HUuiQl In the comments, I'll also share links for acquiring training on Black Mental Health First Aid/First Response.

#WellnessWednesday -- some tips when you're feeling overwhelmed. In the intricate landscape of care and contact disputes, the role of forensic social workers and psychologists is paramount, yet fraught with potential biases that can sway outcomes. My latest article delves into the 'hired gun' phenomenon, where the impartiality of expert assessments is jeopardised, impacting the judicial process and, most importantly, the best interests of the child. Discover how peer review panels could be a game-changer in ensuring fairness and objectivity in forensic evaluations. #ForensicAssessment #ChildWelfare #LegalSystem #Psychology #SocialWork #JudicialIntegrity https://lnkd.in/dM8yxtAb
